snippet: House Republicans blame the needy for the lingering costs of recession.
abstract: Editorial criticizes House Republicans for wanting to reduce the food stamp program with $40 billion in cuts across the next decade; disputes their assertion that it is about saving money,  particularly in light of their plan to increase crop insurance subsidies for farmers; calls on Congress to reject plan put forward by Rep Eric Cantor.
lead_paragraph: House Republicans blame the needy for the lingering costs of recession.
